intro: Bryonia agrestis, commonly known as the field bryony, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and melons. The plant produces yellow flowers and has a distinctive, branching stem covered in spiny hairs. Its fruit is a rough, green capsule that turns orange when mature. Bryonia agrestis is often found in dry, disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
